7ddde70d-725d-4ef4-a0cc-0c2f5ebc2c60.description: The Cultural Diversity & Growth Mindset MicroCredential is designed for pre-service teachers to develop competencies in cultural perspectives & growth mindset to engage and support students in diverse school settings. Pre-service teachers will 1) identify how cultural perspectives & growth mindset influence classroom interactions 2) evaluate impact of cultural perspectives & growth mindset in a classroom 3) create a learning activity incorporating cultural diversity & growth mindset competencies
7ddde70d-725d-4ef4-a0cc-0c2f5ebc2c60.name: Cultural Diversity and Growth Mindset MicroCredential

issuer.summary: issued by P2P/USM Consortium Sponsored by Coppin State University

entity.name: P2P/USM Consortium Sponsored by Coppin State University

alignments.name: Interstate New Teacher Assessment and Support Consortium (InTASC)
alignments.description: 1. Engaging Self: 1.1 (2d, 2j), 1.2 (2j); 2. Engaging Others: 2.1 (2g), 2.2 (2d, 2m, 2n, 5p, 10q); 3. Engaging in Diverse Communities: 3.1 (2a, 9e, 10d), 3.2 (9l, 9m).

badge_template_activities.title: 1. Engaging Self: Demonstrates self-awareness of cultural diversity and growth mindset and how it impacts pedagogy.  1.1 Explores and reflects on how cultural diversity and context influence personal perspectives and practices in education settings. 1.2 Explores, identifies, and synthesizes growth mindset principles and strategies to better support learning and development.

2. Engaging Others:  Demonstrates ability to observe, analyze, and synthesize cultural diversity and growth mindset strategies and best practices in a classroom setting.  2.1 Identifies and evaluates cultural diversity and growth mindset principles and strategies observed in a classroom setting.  2.2 Evaluates, documents, and reflects on how contexts influence teaching strategies and on the use of cultural diversity and growth mindset principles and strategies to address diverse learning needs.

3. Engaging in Diverse Communities: Demonstrates ability to integrate pedagogy with cultural diversity and growth mindset to positively influence student engagement and learning.  3.1 Designs and delivers a learning experience integrating cultural diversity and growth mindset to better engage and support student learning.  3.2 Evaluates and reflects on the effectiveness of delivery, impact on student learning, and strategies for improvement.

88cdfe4b-7d73-4f2b-adf3-03a5d8b39e56.description: The Universal Design for Learning (UDL) MicroCredential is designed for pre-service teachers to develop & demonstrate competencies in UDL principles and strategies to engage & support P-12 students in diverse school settings. Pre-service teachers will 1) identify & evaluate the UDL principles of Representation, Action & Expression, and Engagement; 2) evaluate impact of UDL principles and strategies in a classroom setting; 3) create & deliver a learning activity incorporating UDL competencies.
88cdfe4b-7d73-4f2b-adf3-03a5d8b39e56.name: Universal Design for Learning MicroCredential

issuer.summary: issued by P2P/USM Consortium Sponsored by Coppin State University

entity.name: P2P/USM Consortium Sponsored by Coppin State University

alignments.name: Interstate New Teacher Assessment and Support Consortium (InTASC)
alignments.description: 1. Engaging Self: 1.1 (1d, 1h), 1.2 (1e, 1i, 2g, 2l, 6r); 2. Engaging Others: 2.1 (3i, 3j), 2.2 (5o, 6k, 7k, 8l); 3) Engaging in Diverse Communities: 3.1 (7h, 7l, 7n, 8l), 3.2 (8s)

alignments.name: High Leverage Practices
alignments.description: 1. Engaging Self: 1.1 (14, 19), 1.2 (14, 6); 2. Engaging Others: 2.1 (6, 14), 2.2 (6, 14, 19); 3. Engaging in Diverse Communities: 3.1 (6, 14), 3.2 (1, 14, 19)

alignments.name: Council for Exceptional Children
alignments.description: 1. Engaging Self: 1.1 (1.2), 1.2 (4.4); 2. Engaging Others: 2.1 (2.2), 2.2 (4.2); 3. Engaging in Diverse Communities: 3.1 (5.2), 3.2 (4.4)

badge_template_activities.title: 1. Engaging Self: Demonstrates ability to define and illustrate Universal Design for Learning principles and strategies.  1.1 Explores and articulates the principle elements of Universal Design for Learning.  1.2 Identifies multiple strategies addressing the three principles of UDL in instruction and assessment: Representation, Action & Expression, and Engagement.

2. Engaging Others: Demonstrates ability to identify Universal Design for Learning principles and best practices in diverse classroom settings.  2.1 Identifies and evaluates UDL principles and strategies observed within a classroom setting.  2.2 Evaluates and reflects on classroom use of UDL principles and strategies to address diverse learning needs.

3. Engaging in Diverse Communities:  Demonstrates ability to design and deliver an instructional activity incorporating Universal Design for Learning principles and strategies that support diverse learning needs.  3.1 Designs and delivers a learning experience integrating UDL principals and strategies to better engage and support student learning.  3.2 Evaluates, reflects, and synthesizes on effectiveness of delivery, impact on student learning, and strategies for improvement.

b5c418dc-4eed-44a8-8e6e-556c02d4b3e0.description: The Differentiated Instruction (DI) MicroCredential is designed for pre-service teachers to develop & demonstrate competencies in DI principles & strategies necessary to better engage students in diverse school settings. Teachers will 1) identify DI principles & strategies to meet the needs of diverse learners 2) evaluate the impact of DI principles & strategies in a classroom setting 3) create & deliver a learning activity that incorporates DI competencies across content, process, and product.
b5c418dc-4eed-44a8-8e6e-556c02d4b3e0.name: Differentiated Instruction MicroCredential

issuer.summary: issued by P2P/USM Consortium Sponsored by Coppin State University

entity.name: P2P/USM Consortium Sponsored by Coppin State University

alignments.name: Interstate Teacher Assessment and Support Consortium (InTASC)
alignments.description: 1. Engaging Self: (2a, 4a, 8e); 2. Engaging Others: (2a, 4a, 8e); 3. Engaging in Diverse Communities: (2a, 4a, 8e).

alignments.name: High Leverage Practices
alignments.description: 1. Engaging Self: (12, 19); 2. Engaging Others (3, 12, 15); 3. Engaging in Diverse Communities (3, 12, 15, 19).

badge_template_activities.title: 1. Engaging Self: Demonstrates ability to define and illustrate Differentiated Instruction (DI) principles and strategies to meet the needs of learners in diverse classrooms.  1.1 Explores and articulates principles and strategies of DI to meet the needs of diverse learners across the three areas of content, process, and product.  1.2 Identifies and evaluates multiple strategies of DI to meet the needs of diverse learners across the three areas of content, process, and product.

2. Engaging Others: Demonstrates ability to observe, analyze, and synthesize instructional strategies and best practices of DI to meet the needs of learners in diverse classrooms.  2.1 Identifies and evaluates DI principles and strategies observed within a classroom setting to meet the needs of diverse learners.  2.2 Evaluates and reflects on classroom use of DI principles and strategies to meet the needs of diverse learners across the areas of content, process, and product.

3. Engaging in Diverse Communities: Demonstrates ability to design and deliver an instructional activity incorporating DI principles and strategies that support diverse learning needs.  3.1 Designs and delivers a learning experience integrating DI principles and strategies to better engage and support student learning across the areas of content, process, and product.  3.2 Evaluates and reflects on the effectiveness of delivery, impact on student learning, and strategies for improvement.

c9078435-f67b-4881-bd49-bf7deb977304.description: The Classroom Management (CM) MicroCredential is designed to provide pre-service teachers with the knowledge and skills to effectively manage classrooms at a variety of grade levels and in diverse settings. Teachers will have the opportunity to 1) identify & evaluate CM principles and strategies 2) observe & evaluate CM practices and impact on student learning in a classroom setting 3) create, deliver, and reflect on a learning activity that incorporates successful CM principles and strategies.
c9078435-f67b-4881-bd49-bf7deb977304.name: Classroom Management Microcredential

issuer.summary: issued by P2P/USM Consortium Sponsored by Coppin State University

entity.name: P2P/USM Consortium Sponsored by Coppin State University

alignments.name: Interstate Teacher Assessment and Support Consortium (InTASC)
alignments.description: 1. Engaging Self: 1.1 (3d, 3k), 1.2 (3d, 3k); 2. Engaging Others: 2.1 (3d, 3k), 2.2 (3d, 3k); 3. Engaging in Diverse Communities: 3.1 (3d, 3f, 3k), 3.2 (9b, 9e, 10f), 3.3 (9l, 10f)

badge_template_activities.title: 1. Engaging Self:  Demonstrates self-awareness of various classroom management strategies based on multiple theories.  1.1 Explores and evaluates classroom management theories and models.  1.2 Analyzes and summarizes various classroom management strategies designed to meet the needs of diverse classroom(s).

2. Engaging Others:  Demonstrates an awareness of, and an ability to identify, effective classroom management strategies used in rural, urban, or both settings when feasible.  2.1 Identifies and evaluates perspectives on classroom management in diverse classrooms.  2.2 Evaluates and reflects on organization and management strategies observed in diverse classrooms.

3. Engaging in Diverse Communities:  Demonstrates the ability to embed and implement effective management strategies in classroom practices and reflects upon the successes and challenges when utilizing those strategies.  3.1 Integrates and implements organization and management strategies as appropriate for the learning contexts.  3.2 Assesses options and plans actions.  3.3 Reflects on actions and areas for personal and professional growth.

83379212-c205-4fbe-a47e-6a668e71b180.description: The Family Engagement MicroCredential is designed for pre-service teachers to investigate, research, and implement family engagement best practices in support of student learning and achievement. Teachers will 1) identify and evaluate principles and strategies of family engagement; 2) observe and evaluate the impact of school activities on reaching families and supporting student learning; and 3) create, deliver, and reflect on an activity that incorporates competencies in family engagement.
83379212-c205-4fbe-a47e-6a668e71b180.name: Family Engagement MicroCredential

issuer.summary: issued by P2P/USM Consortium Sponsored by Coppin State University

entity.name: P2P/USM Consortium Sponsored by Coppin State University

alignments.name: Interstate Teacher Assessment and Support Consortium (InTASC)
alignments.description: 1. Engaging Self: 1.1 (7b, 10c), 1.2 (2b, 4a, 9a, 10d); 2. Engaging Others: 2.1 (2b, 8b, 10c), 2.2 (6d, 7e, 8c); 3. Engaging in Diverse Communities: 3.1 (1e, 5c, 10c), 3.2 (10f)

alignments.name: High Leverage Practices
alignments.description: 1. Engaging Self: 1.1 (10, 11, 12, 13); 2. Engaging Others: 2.1 (12), 2.2 (19); 3. Engaging in Diverse Communities: 3.1 (11, 12, 13), 3.2 (19)

badge_template_activities.title: 1. Engaging Self: Demonstrates ability to define and illustrate family engagement principles and strategies to better support student learning and achievement in diverse communities.  1.1 Explores, identifies, and synthesizes the principles and strategies of family engagement to better engage family and support learning needs.  1.2 Explores personal biases and develops educational philosophy in areas of family engagement for professional growth and development.

2. Engaging Others: Demonstrates ability to observe, analyze, and synthesize family engagement strategies and best practices in school and/or community settings.  2.1 Identifies and evaluates family engagement principles and strategies observed within a family and/or community engagement setting.  2.2 Synthesizes and reflects on perspectives from diverse families and applies knowledge to own practices.

3. Engaging in Diverse Communities: Demonstrates ability to design and deliver a parent-teacher activity incorporating family engagement strategies to better engage families and support learners’ needs.  3.1 Co-designs and co-implements a parent-teacher conference activity with a mentor teacher that integrates family engagement principles and strategies.  3.2 Evaluates, reflects on, and synthesizes the effectiveness of delivery, impact on student learning, and strategies for improvement.

9399ad91-efb7-464e-a953-2b1f83cd4446.description: The Social Emotional Learning (SEL) MicroCredential allows educators to develop & demonstrate SEL-related knowledge, skills, & professional dispositions necessary to support student learning. Educators will 1) define & identify SEL competencies & skills; 2) observe & evaluate the impact of SEL in a classroom; 3) design, & deliver a learning segment incorporating SEL competencies & skills; and 4) plan & deliver a professional development presentation centered on SEL integration in the classroom.
9399ad91-efb7-464e-a953-2b1f83cd4446.name: Social and Emotional Learning MicroCredential

issuer.summary: issued by P2P/USM Consortium Sponsored by Coppin State University

entity.name: P2P/USM Consortium Sponsored by Coppin State University

alignments.name: Interstate New Teacher Assessment and Support Consortium (InTASC)
alignments.description: 1. Engaging Self: 1.1 (1e, 1h, 2l), 1.2 (8a, 8q); 2. Engaging Others: 2.1 (3k), 2.2 (8b, 9h); 3. Engaging in Diverse Communities: 3.1 (1f, 4n), 3.2 (7j)

alignments.name: High Leverage Practices
alignments.description: 1. Engaging Self: 1.1 (5, 19), 1.2 (2); 2. Engaging Others: 2.1 (1), 2.2 (17, 19); 3. Engaging in Diverse Communities: 3.1 (6), 3.2 (19)

badge_template_activities.title: 1. Engaging Self: Demonstrates ability to define and illustrate the five components of comprehensive SEL. 1.1 Explores, articulates and analyzes the components of comprehensive SEL. 1.2 Identifies multiple strategies for addressing the components of SEL.

2. Engaging Others: Demonstrates ability to identify SEL in diverse classroom settings. 2.1 Identifies and evaluates SEL skills observed within a classroom setting. 2.2 Evaluates and reflects on classroom use of SEL skills to address student performance.

3. Engaging in Diverse Communities: Demonstrates ability to design and deliver a learning segment incorporating SEL skills and strategies that support diverse learning needs. 3.1 Designs and delivers a learning experience integrating SEL skills to better engage and support student performance. 3.2 Evaluates, reflects on, and synthesizes the effectiveness of lesson delivery, impact on SEL, and strategies for improvement.

6f80b6c0-08d8-4157-9f19-de1b008a0cde.description: The Culturally Responsive Practices MicroCredential is designed for new teachers to develop competencies in Culturally Responsive Practices (CRPs) to create learning environments and curricular activities that are equitable and supportive of all learners. Teachers will 1) identify & evaluate principles and strategies of CRPs 2) demonstrate CRPs in their classrooms 3) evaluate the impact of CRPs on school activities to support student learning and inform colleagues' professional development.
6f80b6c0-08d8-4157-9f19-de1b008a0cde.name: Culturally Responsive Practices MicroCredential

issuer.summary: issued by P2P/USM Consortium Sponsored by Coppin State University

entity.name: P2P/USM Consortium Sponsored by Coppin State University

alignments.name: Interstate New Teacher Assessment and Support Consortium (InTASC)
alignments.description: 1. Engaging Self: 1.1 (1i, 1e, 2f), 1.2 (1b, 1d, 2j, 4b, 8e, 8k, 8p); 2. Engaging Others: 2.1 (2a, 2d, 2l, 6e), 2.2 (2m, 2n, 3d, 7b, 8r); 3. Engaging in Diverse Communities: 3.1 (2j, 2k, 3a), 3.2 (3f), 3.3 (3i)

badge_template_activities.title: 1. Engaging Self: Demonstrates ability to define and illustrate knowledge of culturally responsive principles, practices and strategies to support student learning in the classroom and diverse communities. 1.1 Explores and identifies principles and strategies of Culturally Responsive Practices to engage with and support all students’ needs. 1.2 Synthesizes culturally responsive strategies applicable in the classroom, school and diverse communities for professional growth and development.

2. Engaging Others: Demonstrates ability to observe, plan, implement & analyze best practices in culturally responsive pedagogy that engage students in the classroom, school, and/or community settings. 2.1 Identifies & evaluates culturally responsive principles and strategies observed within the classroom setting and during instruction. 2.2 Synthesizes & reflects on best CRP principles and strategies and applies knowledge to own classroom

3. Engaging in Diverse Communities: Demonstrates cultural competence and the ability to design and implement instruction in culturally responsive settings to support all students' needs. 3.1 Designs and delivers learning experiences that integrate culturally responsive principles, practices and strategies. 3.2 Evaluates the effectiveness of delivery, impact on student learning, and strategies for self-improvement. 3.3 Develops a CRP professional development presentation for colleagues.

95e2597e-2081-4a3a-912e-39bf3e2c39c2.description: The Assessment & Progress Monitoring MicroCredential is designed for pre-service teachers to develop & demonstrate competencies in using differentiated assessment processes to support students in diverse settings. Teachers will 1) identify differentiated assessment & monitoring principles 2) evaluate the impact of differentiated assessment & monitoring strategies in a classroom 3) create & deliver a learning activity incorporating competencies in differentiated assessment & progress monitoring.
95e2597e-2081-4a3a-912e-39bf3e2c39c2.name: Assessment and Progress Monitoring MicroCredential

issuer.summary: issued by P2P/USM Consortium Sponsored by Coppin State University

entity.name: P2P/USM Consortium Sponsored by Coppin State University

alignments.name: Interstate Teacher Assessment and Support Consortium (InTASC)
alignments.description: 1. Engaging Self: 1.1 (3l, 2j, 1g, 6j, 6k), 1.2 (3m, 6b, 6e, 6g, 6i, 8b); 2. Engaging Others: 2.1 (6j, 6k, 6l), 2.2 (9c); 3. Engaging in Diverse Communities: 3.1 (1a, 4f, 6e, 6g, 6h, 6p, 6q, 6r), 3.2 (1a, 4f, 6e, 6g, 6h, 6p, 6q, 6r)

alignments.name: High Leverage Practices
alignments.description: 1. Engaging Self: 1.1 (12), 1.2 (16, 17); 2. Engaging Others: 2.1 (16), 2.2 (17); 3. Engaging in Diverse Communities: 3.1 (16, 17), 3.2 (16, 17, 19)

badge_template_activities.title: 1. Engaging Self: Demonstrates ability to define and illustrate differentiated assessment and progress monitoring principles and strategies to better support diverse learners.  1.1 Explores, analyzes, and synthesizes the attributes of differentiated assessment that are responsive to diverse learning needs.  1.2 Explores, analyzes, and synthesizes the attributes of progress monitoring and implications for instructional decision-making.

2. Engaging Others: Demonstrates ability to identify and analyze differentiated assessment and progress monitoring principles & strategies through observation, teacher interview, and reflection.  2.1 Identifies and analyzes differentiated assessment and progress monitoring principles & strategies that are implemented in a classroom setting.  2.2 Evaluates and reflects on classroom use of differentiated assessment and progress monitoring principles & strategies to address diverse learning needs.

3. Engaging in Diverse Communities: Demonstrates ability to design and deliver an instructional activity incorporating differentiated assessment and progress monitoring principles & strategies that support diverse learning needs.  3.1 Designs and delivers a learning experience integrating differentiated assessment and progress monitoring strategies to better support diverse learners.  3.2 Evaluates and reflects on effectiveness of delivery, impact on student learning, strategies for improvement.

d4545858-7757-4f01-a16c-998ff8950bd4.description: The Critical Thinking (CT) MicroCredential is designed to provide new teachers with the knowledge & skills necessary to design & deliver learning opportunities that build students’ CT and problem-solving skills. Teachers will 1) identify and evaluate CT research, principles & strategies 2) conduct observations outside their own classrooms, identifying CT skills & strategies 3) design & deliver an instructional unit incorporating CT principles & strategies 4) plan & deliver PD centered on CT.
d4545858-7757-4f01-a16c-998ff8950bd4.name: Critical Thinking Skills: Educate to Innovate MicroCredential

issuer.summary: issued by P2P/USM Consortium Sponsored by Coppin State University

entity.name: P2P/USM Consortium Sponsored by Coppin State University

alignments.name: Interstate New Teacher Assessment and Support Consortium (InTASC)
alignments.description: 1. Engaging Self: 1.1 (1d, 1e, 4j, 4o), 1.2 (4j, 4o); 2. Engaging Others: 2.1 (1b, 1d, 3b, 3c, 3n, 3p, 3r, 5r, 5s), 2.2 (4b, 4c, 4d, 4g, 5a, 5b, 5d, 5f, 5s, 7h, 7k, 8f, 8g, 8i, 8j), 2.3 (9g, 9k, 9l, 9n); 3. Engaging in Diverse Communities: 3.1 (10f, 10i)

alignments.name: High Leverage Practices
alignments.description: 2. Engaging Others: 2.2 (14), 2.3 (19); 3. Engaging in Diverse Communities: 3.1 (1, 2)

badge_template_activities.title: 1. Engaging Self: Demonstrates self-awareness of critical thinking research, principles, and strategies and their impact on academic engagement. 1.1 Explores and reflects on how critical thinking skills can be incorporated in daily classroom practice in one’s grade level and content area. 1.2 Explores, identifies, and synthesizes knowledge of critical thinking to better support learning and development in one’s classroom.

2. Engaging Others: Demonstrates ability to observe, plan, and implement instruction that requires students to engage in CT. 2.1 Observes in an educational setting outside of one’s classroom and identifies CT principles and strategies utilized. 2.2 Designs and delivers a learning segment in which students engage in lessons that require CT. 2.3 Evaluates and reflects on the effectiveness of the delivery of the learning segment, the impact on student learning, and strategies for improvement

3. Engaging in Diverse Communities: Demonstrates ability to share knowledge of critical thinking with a diverse educational community. 3.1 Designs and delivers a presentation centered around critical thinking research, principles, and strategies to a professional learning community (PLC) or university class.

4909e68b-8d3d-4f27-b28d-91eee97112f1.description: The Transformational Technology for Teaching & Learning MicroCredential is designed for educators to gain strategies to integrate digital experiences into lessons to enhance student learning. Educators will also conduct research on free educational tech tools and resources that can be adopted to increase equitable access to technology and will learn about the educational tech hardware, software, and strategies already being implemented in their schools & districts.
4909e68b-8d3d-4f27-b28d-91eee97112f1.name: Transformational Technology for Teaching & Learning MicroCredential

issuer.summary: issued by P2P/USM Consortium Sponsored by Coppin State University

entity.name: P2P/USM Consortium Sponsored by Coppin State University

alignments.name: Interstate New Teacher Assessment and Support Consortium (InTASC)
alignments.description: 1. Engaging Self: 1.1 (9f), 1.2 (4n, 7g), 1.3 (5l, 8), 1.4 (9a); 2. Engaging Others: 2.1 (9c), 2.2 (7c, 8), 2.3 (5h, 6), 2.4 (9k); 3. Engaging in Diverse Communities: 3.1 (10e), 3.2 (9d, 10), 3.3 (10i)

alignments.name: International Society for Technology in Education (ISTE)

badge_template_activities.title: 1. Engaging Self: Demonstrates knowledge and skills necessary to integrate transformational technology in the classroom. 1.1 Examine current policies and advancements in educational tech. 1.2 Explore tech standards for teachers and students. 1.3 Observe & synthesize the personalized and blended learning models used by classroom teachers. 1.4 Self-reflect on current ability to plan & implement digital age learning in the classroom and plans to develop future transformational tech integration.

2. Engaging Others: Demonstrates ability to integrate, analyze, & synthesize personalized and blended learning through educational technology. 2.1 Interview the tech coordinator to determine available tech in the school, national trends & district-led directions for the implementation of educational tech. 2.2 Enhance a lesson by integrating transformational tech. 2.3 Implement integrated lesson plan & assess impact in meeting tech standards. 2.4 Design a Tech Professional Development Plan.

3. Engaging in Diverse Communities: Share with a diverse educational community knowledge, skills, and application of transformational technology. 3.1 Share with team members within the school the knowledge, skills, and application of transformational technology. 3.2 Create a blog entry that outlines knowledge, skills, and experience along the journey to implementing a technology-rich learning environment. 3.2 Share Technology Professional Development Plan with supervisors.

5702643c-21bf-4ae7-b745-53bf181f0238.description: The Personalized Competency-Based Education (PCBE) Strategies MicroCredential creates opportunities for practicing teachers to implement PCBE instruction and support students by focusing on Personalized Learning Strategies (PLS) to guide all students to succeed. PCBE involves the concepts of outcome-based education and mastery learning to develop instructional approaches that allow students to achieve based on their abilities and backgrounds.
5702643c-21bf-4ae7-b745-53bf181f0238.name: Competency-Based Education Strategies MicroCredential

issuer.summary: issued by P2P/USM Consortium Sponsored by Coppin State University

entity.name: P2P/USM Consortium Sponsored by Coppin State University

alignments.name: Interstate New Teacher Assessment and Support Consortium (InTASC)
alignments.description: 1. Engaging Self: 1.2 (2g); 2. Engaging Others: 2.1 (7a, 7g, 8d, 8l), 2.2 (6c, 6l), 2.3 (6o); 3. Engaging in Diverse Communities: 3.1 (9d, 10f, 10i)

alignments.name: High Leverage Practices
alignments.description: 1. Engaging Self: 1.2 (4); 2. Engaging Others: 2.1 (13, 14, 16), 2.2 (15, 16), 2.3 (17); 3. Engaging in Diverse Communities: 3.1 (19)

badge_template_activities.title: 1. Engaging Self: Demonstrates the knowledge and skills necessary to implement Personalized Competency-Based Education (PCBE) strategies in the classroom. Explores the framework and strategies involved in PCBE practices. 1.1 Develops an understanding of PCBE. 1.2 Evaluates student attributes that are an essential part of PCBE practices (Metacognition, Self-Regulated Learning, and Academic Perseverance) to decide what skill is most needed to support independent student work.

2. Engaging Others: Demonstrates ability to implement, analyze, and synthesize evidenced-based outcomes of competency-based strategies in assigned classroom. 2.1 Designs a Personalized Competency-Based Education (PCBE) unit with experienced teacher(s) in the school. 2.2 Implements the PCBE unit and assess student impact to determine the success of students using the PLS strategies. 2.3 Evaluates and reflects on the effectiveness of the PCBE unit and strategies for improvement.

3. Engaging in Diverse Communities: Shares the outcomes of the PCBE unit in a presentation to a diverse educational community and seek feedback. 3.1 Uses one of the following methods to develop, present, and discuss the strategies used and the impact of the strategies on student learning: 1) school district-led workshop, 2) blog or video, or 3) local, regional or national conference.

346b7c7f-b91a-4213-a149-723c66cadf9a.description: The Increasing Academic Engagement through the Implementation of a Behavior Support Plan MicroCredential is designed for new teachers to develop, demonstrate, and communicate competencies in identifying and reducing behaviors that interfere with academic engagement.
346b7c7f-b91a-4213-a149-723c66cadf9a.name: Increasing Academic Engagement MicroCredential

issuer.summary: issued by P2P/USM Consortium Sponsored by Coppin State University

entity.name: P2P/USM Consortium Sponsored by Coppin State University

alignments.name: Interstate New Teacher Assessment and Support Consortium (InTASC)
alignments.description: 1. Engaging Self: 1.1 (2a), 2.1 (2f, 3k, 9h); 2. Engaging Others: 2.1 (6a, 6g, 6l), 2.2 (9h, 9l); 3. Engaging in Diverse Communities: 3.1 (2g, 6l, 9h), 3.2 (2j)

alignments.name: High Leverage Practices
alignments.description: 1. Engaging Self: 1.1 (7), 1.2 (7, 13); 2. Engaging Others: 2.1 (7), 2.2 (7, 19); 3. Engaging in Diverse Communities: 3.1 (7), 3.2 (7, 19)

badge_template_activities.title: 1. Engaging Self: Demonstrates self-awareness of behavior and how it impacts academic engagement. 1.1 Explores and reflects on how the function of a behavior in an educational setting limits academic engagement. 1.2 Explores, identifies, and synthesizes knowledge of behavior support plans to increase learning and development for all students.

2. Engaging Others: Demonstrates ability to complete a classroom observation of students’ behavior and design a behavior support plan to influence academic engagement and learning for all students. 2.1 Designs and delivers a behavior support plan based on a classroom observation to better engage and support student learning. 2.2 Evaluates and reflects on effectiveness of delivery, impact on student learning, and strategies for improvement.

3. Engaging in Diverse Communities: Demonstrates ability to observe, analyze & synthesize evidence-based strategies and best practices to reduce interfering behaviors in a classroom setting. 3.1 Identifies & evaluates behavior support plan principles & strategies observed in a classroom setting. 3.2 Evaluates, documents & reflects on how contexts influence behavior support plan strategies used to increase academic engagement in diverse settings.
